meanings.definition: The source or origin of a river.
meanings.sent1: The headwaters of the stream were crystal clear and cold.
meanings.sent2: The headwaters of the river start high in the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The headwaters decided to take a detour and flow in the opposite direction.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was the headwaters of inspiration for the team.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the headwaters of knowledge can lead to great discoveries.

meanings.definition: The upper part of a river.
meanings.sent1: We set up camp near the headwaters to enjoy the peaceful surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The headwaters are often narrower and faster-moving than the lower parts of the river.
meanings.sent3: The headwaters seemed to be the perfect spot for a picnic with a view.
meanings.sent4: The headwaters flowed swiftly, carrying leaves and twigs along the way.
meanings.sent5: Birds chirped happily near the headwaters, adding to the serene atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: The headwaters bubbled up from the ground, marking the start of the stream.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen often visit the headwaters to catch trout in the clear water.
meanings.sent3: The headwaters playfully danced over rocks on their way downstream.
meanings.sent4: The headwaters whispered secrets to the passing leaves as they journeyed forth.
meanings.sent5: Explorers set out to find the headwaters of the mysterious stream.
